Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, close to train station”
Reviews.Author: MTNR_FAN
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel due to it's proximity to the train station, it's literally few blocks away and believe me that helps when you are hauling those bags on the streets of Venice. The hotel itself is decent, not a 4 star by any means though. Our room faced the busy main street and got bright early morning, the carpets were dirty, the bathrooms was clean, but the shower curtain was a cheap dollar store quality flying all over you while you are trying to take a shower. Also the A/C was switched off, apparently the city controls when to switch them on or atleast that's what we were told, in a rude way, I must add by the concierge Mr. Emmanuella, who was one of the rudest front desk person I've ever encountered. The breakfast is okay with eggs, breads and jams and the internet is free. Overall, I would say it's an alright hotel, not romantic, but will work if you plan on staying couple of nights in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: WONG C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location quite near train station and purchase shop, room very clean and quiet staff very nice to settle my questions, but their wife just allow one device connect, i think not enough, i will give 80 marks.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 4* but a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: babyboo80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently with an online offer which included flights and accommodation as a package. It was a choice of 3 hotels and we chose this one as it had more Venetian character than the other 2 on offer which looked more contemporary/chain. We found the hotel very easily as it's just across the main bridge from the bus station. Location wise - it's perfect for arriving and leaving as you don't have to trek all across the city. It's only down the road from the Ferrovia waterbus stops. It's a fair walk to San Marco but to be honest once we went there, we didn't really need to go back again as there were lots of other sights to see nearby. The outside of the hotel looked very impressive and pretty much looked how I'd imagine it to be. The service was great - we didn't ask for anything during our stay so I can't comment if we had done so. They expect the keys to be returned to the desk each and every time you leave the hotel which we found odd as never experienced that courtesy. The lift was small but we didn't have much to carry so we used the stairs instead. I could imagine if we had more it would have been quite uncomfortable. The room was lovely! Exactly what I expected it to be dÃ©cor wise. The shower head was quite old and rusty in places so we had to use a cocktail stick to poke through the holes so more water came out! The bed was comfy - more comfy than most hotels we've stayed in. Breakfast was a hot and cold buffet - was expecting a cold buffet so was pleasantly surprised when there was bacon, eggs and toast on offer. As we knew Venice was going to be quite expensive to eat out this was a perfect solution to our budget! I wouldn't have ordinarily chosen this hotel if it wasn't part of an online offer, however we really enjoyed our stay and it looks like we were very lucky with room 309 based on what other reviewers have said about theirs! We knew this was going to be an older style hotel - the walls were pretty thin and it could do with a lick of paint here and there and maybe if another online offer came about we would stay there again; however the only thing I would comment on is that it didn't really feel like a 4* hotel - just a posh 3*

Reviews.Title: “This should be downgraded to a 2 star property”
Reviews.Author: LondonIrishlass
Reviews.Content: Having been so upset by the standard of hotels and changed rooms in other hotels I was too jaded to speak to reception to get this changed. The lift is miniscule and just about took me, my husband, one large and one small suitcase at a push. The door of our room had to be shoved open as it got wedged before opening fully. There was a damp spot and hole in the ceiling, the ceiling tiles above the doorway were scuffed and scratched, the wallpaper to the corner was torn, the wall light fitting was loose, the window frame was loose, the plaster above the window frame was coming away in chunks, there were gaps in the ceiling tiles over the bath, the shower head fitting was not fitted together so water came out of the holes and across the top of the shower from the gap. My biggest gripe was the unusal step in the bathroom - the toilet and the bidet were on the step but you could not comfortably put your feet on the step and in my case because I am short had the lean forward on my tiptoes while cutting off the circulation to my legs. The window in the hall was broken with pieces of glass missing. On two occasions we came back to our room to find it unlocked after housekeeping. On the first occasion I was extremely distressed as I had left my handbag in the room on the floor on my way to breakfast and on my return from breakfast there it was sitting on the freshly made bed in an unlocked room. The problem with this is that it is very clear to see when a room is unlocked as it shows white when unlocked and red when locked above the door handle. The bed was large and comfortable, the pillows were flat and hard. I either had the covers up to my chin or thrown off as the heating seemed to have a mind of its own. We could hear our neighbours use the bathroom as the plumbing system was very loud and when the hairdryer was used. I had no sleep one night when the local restaurant decided that they were going to clean the kitchen with much banging of plates and dropping of pans - closing the back door of the kitchen might have helped. Breakfast is plentiful with scrambled eggs and bacon on offer as the hot option. There is also cheese and ham available. There are croissants all of which are glazed some with jam as a filling as some with honey. There is fruit salad also. On our first few mornings coffee pots were brought out to us (bland weak coffee). On our final morning we came down to a shiny new drinks dispenser - finally a decent strong cup of coffee. However, it does sound like you are on the set of a sci-fi movie with all the noises it makes. I was surprised there were not more cold meats or even tomatoes as an option. The hotel is in a wonderful location between Guglie and Ferrovia Vaporetto stops. There are lots of shops and restaurants in the area and you are a 5 minute walk from the train station and 10 minutes over the large bridge to the bus station. It is about a 20-25 walk to San Marco. We ate a couple of times in Ae Oche just down from the hotel towards Ferrovia. Avoid the restaurant to the left on exiting the hotel. Restaurants can add both a 12% service charge and a cover charge and do not be caught out as we were with the Venice tourist tax which you will be asked to pay on signing out of the hotel. This is not a cheap city even McDonalds is ridiculously expensive. If this hotel smartened up it could become a 4 star establishment again but it does need some serious work.

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: uptowngirl57
Reviews.Content: We were "bumped" to this hotel by it's sister property, Hotel Grand Principe - across the street and 50 yards away. We loved it - a little more intimate but with spacious beautiful rooms. We were initially disappointed since the other hotel is on the Grand Canal, but we had paid for lower-priced rooms and really didn't expect to face the water, and our rooms in the Amadeus were probably much better than the ones we would have gotten across the street. One note- many of the guide books warn you against staying near the train station because it's busy and touristy. However, included in our group of 8 were my parents, age 80, who simply could not have dragged their luggage through the streets of Venice, up and down bridges, like so many people we saw who stayed away from the main area but who weren't on a canal accessible by boat. I am a fit marathon runner and I can tell you that I wouldn't have wanted to carry my luggage across Venice. So staying near the station was terrific for us - easy vaporetto access to everywhere. The staff was very friendly and helpful - including the night before we left, when just as I was drifting off to sleep I realized I'd left a shopping bag in our dinner restaurant down the street. The person at the desk (wish I'd gotten his name) helped me figure out the name of the restaurant on Google, then called them and caught them as they were closing and asked them to wait. My husband and I threw on some jeans and hustled over there and retreived the bag, but it wouldn't have happened without his help. They also facilitated our communication with our water taxi to the airport, which had been faxed to the hotel we were bumped from and not forwarded. Very, very helpful staff. The hotel has a lovely breakfast room and bar, with white fabric-draped chairs and tables, pretty flowered china, and chafing dish service of hot and cold foods. Breakfast was included and was more than ample to hold you until lunch. And, the bartender in the evening went out of his way to make American-style cocktails for us (including very good Mojitos.) The bathrooms were marble and had excellent hot water pressure. The rooms feature mini bars, and a pillow selection in terms of firmness, along with individual room temp controls. Our rooms looked out over a pretty courtyard with flowers and a fountain. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - we emphatically reccomend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LanPing
Reviews.Content: This is Venice; it is old and cramped, but exquisitely stylish. So is this hotel Conveniently located 10 mins and only 1 bridge from the railway station; grocery stores, banks and coffee shops close by. Rooms small but perfectly adequate and clean; attractively priced No internet AT ALL - but this is Venice, so why would you want to be online when there is so much to see all around you? Buffet breakfast is absolutely fantastic, though the coffee machine is slightly scary

Reviews.Title: “If only I could think of something good to say!”
Reviews.Author: jwjwjwjw1
Reviews.Content: There was an in-room safe if you laid on the floor to access it. It is near the train station Other than that.... It is an old historic hotel that desperately needs to be refurbished. It is not directly on the canal; perhaps that is a good thing as we only had a few mosquitos in the room. There are no screens on the windows so to get fresh air, they need to be opened. Our room had windows on three sides, though there were no views. There is no wi-fi period. If you want to submit a credit card to a off-site provider, that is possible. The hotel will provide no assistance with this. Many travelers are not in the habit of leaving the key in the lobby when going out. However, the night manager who had multiple times to be nice (and failed each time) verbally attacked us for not leaving the key with him when we left. There are no coffee/tea-making facilities, and the breakfast-to-go bag was minimal at best. There has to be a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: pjshakespeare
Reviews.Content: We really loved our room. The breakfast room is fantastic. Don't miss the courtyard where you can sit outside. When we arrived, we walked to the hotel from the bus that brought us from the airport for only 5 euros. Then when we left, walked to the train station. convenient. During our stay, we found it an easy walk to the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok...”
Reviews.Author: LizzVal
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't rate this hotel as a 4 star hotel. Very nice breakfast and breakfast garden area, staff was decent, very conveniently situated by the train station so no need for taxi boat. Didn't like that there were no irons in the rooms, you have to use their laundry service. Very outdated/old looking. Far walking distance to St. Marks Square so be prepared. I would probably take bus service outside of train station, but they were on strike while we were there so we were stuck walking. Probably over an hour walk to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent breakfast in a central hotel”
Reviews.Author: sydneygirl182
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in August and really enjoyed our stay. We had originally booked at the Gardena Hotel, however, when we arrived there had been a large group booking and we'd been relocated to the Amadeus Hotel. The hotel is only a 10 minute walk from the train or bus stations and is centrally located for all public transport. It's about a 30 min walk (or so) to San Marco square but walking is the best way to see Venice.. The room was small (but ithat's to be expected), nicely appointed with excellent air conditioning and a good bathroom. We did miss having wifi available but for only 2 days we deemed the lobby option of 8 euros an hour to be far too extravagant but instead used wifi at several restaurants. After a week in Italy, my partner loved the breakfasts which had a good selection of eggs, bacon, pastries, ham, cheese, fruit and cereals with the usual drinks with breakfast running until 11am.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - but not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: AVisitor80126
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel - the room was very nice, very quiet and in a good location. Food at the restaurant was OK, but nothing special. Staff was OK, but pretty indifferent. Asked for assistance on making a international collect call, and was told it doesn't work. We had expected to stay at the Principe (will take up with the tour operator). After expecting a room with a view of the Grand Canal, got a room on the other side of the street with a view of the wall next door about three feet away.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless 100% If you find fault then U would find fault with anything!!”
Reviews.Author: GIB3366
Reviews.Content: We were on a cruise going out of Venice, so we booked one night at the at the Amadeus Hotel at the start and one night at the end. We arrived in a party of 4 with a baby and 5 cases, hot sticky and tired. On arrival we were told they had a computer problem and over book so they had no rooms available. We were transferred to a 5 star hotel which had a beach on a island outside of Venice. They provided a water taxi to the island and then back to the cruise ship. The hotel provided free water taxi to and from S Marks Sq. It was a fantastic totally free upgrade. I salute you Amadeus Hotel for covering your error in real style. On our return from the cruise we actually stayed in the hotel. It was very pleasant. A large room. A nice garden to relax in. Nice breakfast, also, we knew nothing about Venice before we went. You want an hotel near the entrance of the island as a base, save dragging your cases around. Amadeus is right there. Outside the hotel was a quiet bar for that late night drink were you can sit out on the street an watch the world walk by.

Reviews.Title: “as a one night stop over it's ok!”
Reviews.Author: Jansbuyingmachine
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight before joining a cruise from Venice. The hotel was quite easy to find and close enough to Piazzale Roma and train station. I wouldn't class this hotel as four star. The bed room was basic and dated, the bathroom needs work with the tiles around the sink coming away. The staff were pleasant and the service quite good. The breakfast was basic. The price of the hotel stay was reasonable for a hotel in Vinice but elsewhere would be overpriced in my opinion. Overall the hotel is ok but having stayed elsewhere in Venice I probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: reunion_8
Reviews.Content: Had booked at Hotel Gardena but on arrival they advised that we had been upgraded to the 4star Amadeus another hotel in the group. Slightly further to walk from Piazza Roma but not a problem. We stayed for 1 night prior to a cruise and can confirm that the rooms and breakfast were to a high standard. Had one hot course included with breakfast buffet. Very close to railway station and no bridges to climb if coming from station with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel we stayed in in Italy”
Reviews.Author: syder
Reviews.Content: We were in Italy for a month recently for our honeymoon and this was the worst hotel we stayed in. When we arrived we were taken to what is obviously their "first offer" for travelers that may not have any fight left in them. This was at the back of the hotel accessed from a very small and rickety lift. The room they showed us looked like it was rented by the hour. Very shabby, worn, smelly, dirty and frayed with 2 single beds with 2 single sheet sets pushed together. The porter arrived at our door without our bags in clear anticipation of what was to come in a way that seemed like he had been through it a few times before. We were barely able to finish telling him we were not happy when he had directed us to call reception where we were told "don't touch nothing and come back down" There we were asked to explain why we didn't like the room. After explaining that we were on our honeymoon and the room was far from romantic despite being in Venice, they then denied they had any knowledge that we were on our honeymoon and it was not their fault we were taken to that room. This begs the question as to who this room is actually for? Perhaps someone that desires a room that looks like a motel on a remote highway rather than the 4 star accommodation they had paid for? We were then taken to a much better part of the hotel at the front of the building. The decor was a big improvement but we were shown a very small room with about 2 cm of mold growing over the bathroom. This was due to the fact as we discovered that the shower sprayed into the bedroom floor. We spent one night in there before asking if there was anything else available. As someone had checked out we were allowed to take the suite for the rest of stay. It was quite large and in slightly better condition but still nowhere near 4 star accommodation even for Italy. Service was lazy, and indifferent. There are many hotels in Venice for a similar price in better locations choose somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic stay in Venice, Nice 4-star (italian) hotel”
Reviews.Author: BestQuality
Reviews.Content: After reading all the other reviews I can tell that why everyone is so disappointed. Sadly, that;s what a 4-star-hotel looks like in Italy. I also believe that it is nothing more than a 3 star but that's the Italian standard. The huge gap between an avergae hotel and a luxus hotel would be between a 4 star rating and a 4 star superior rating. 4+ stars / 5 stars / 5+ stars can be seen as luxus hotels in Italy, anything else under that is just average. and so is Amadeus. Anyway, I was celebrating my 1 year relationship with my girlfriend and, yeah, this hotel did the job. I received a beatiful suite on a higher floor, kind of dark but red all over. I could also say that the mirror on the ceiling in the bedroom helped with the romantic part. We spent a lot of time outside so I couldn't say much about other amenities or so. Let's keep the 4 stars, with the italian point of view in mind! Next time? A couple of bucks more --> Il Palazzo Bauer Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 stars that the hotel claims, but just a 3-star”
Reviews.Author: drphilm
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at the Amadeus because the hotel I booked, the Principe, turned out to be closed. I was not happy about this, because I did not get a discount on the price I had accepted for the Principe, ie for a higher quality of service and amenity. The Amadeus is a good 3-star hotel that claims to be a 4-star one. It's on Lista di Spagna, a few doors down from the Principe on the other side of the street. The area is fine - it has plenty of restaurants, shops and hotels, and is close to St Lucia station and the Ferrovia vaporetto stops. The hotel is a bit dated, its furniture and panelling recall the post-war years, and the feeling is one of staidness. However the staff were friendly and helpful, and always courteous, even when having to enforce the requirements of the Italian Government regarding registering foreigners (copying passports). The room was fairly spacious, but the double bed turned out to be two single beds made up separately and then pushed together - so no room to stretch out. The bathroom had a shower over the bath - always a worry when you're elderly and at risk of slipping and falling. Unfortunately, the shower rose was almost completely blocked up, so a few jets of water shot out in all directions but not on the body standing underneath hoping for a warm stream of water. It was necessary to use the body rinsing shower for the bath to have a shower. Another problem with the bathroom was that, despite having a heater that was on all the time, the room never got warm. Breakfast was a buffet, but the only hot dishes were scrambled egg and bacon - hardly 4-star stuff. Also, there was no fresh fruit, but there were tinned fruit salad and pineapple, poor substitutes at best. Also, the orange juice was tinned also. For toast there were round slices of brown (pumpernickel) or white bread, but a number of people tried slicing the bread rolls in half and toasting them, much too the anxiety of the staff when a bit of roll got stuck in the toaster and could be smelt burning. For the first four days of my stay the wifi internet was available in the lobby and free. On the last evening it was no longer free, now costing 6 euros for an hour. It seems that the group owning the hotel had decided to outsource the provision of the internet, and hadn't bothered to tell anyone, apparently including the hotel staff in advance. IN summary, not the 4-star hotel experience I'd booked.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not four stars”
Reviews.Author: profecto
Reviews.Content: I have already posted a comment under the Principe Hotel Venice to the effect that we booked the Principe but were not told it was closed and were put in the Amadeus which we would never have considered staying at. While the Amadeus is nowhere near the standard of the Principe, it is not all bad. We like the position of the Amadeus on Lista di Spagna because it is close to station and therefore easy to get to and from with suitcases, and the street and those nearby are full of eating places and shops. We found the staff courteous, the hotel was clean, our rooms were quiet, the beds were comfortable, and the towels and linen were of good quality. There are two main reasons I do not consider this hotel meets four star standard (1) Breakfast: the range of foods is limited compared with real four star hotels, and the fruit and fruit juice are from tins. (2) There are two sections to the hotel - there is only one lift in the 'blue' section and it measures around 2 x 3 feet and is disgracefully scruffy (see photo). When a party of Japanese tourists booked in there was a long queue for this tiny lift. Another gripe was that towards the end of our stay a charge for Wifi connection was imposed without notice - it went from being free to 6 euros per hour or 10 euros per day.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy mouldy room, mean desk manager, ugly hotel”
Reviews.Author: we-have-a-pet-dog
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night (11.30 pm) and the area was scary with unsavoury type of characters lurking in the streets and corners. We arrived at the hotel (if you can call it that), only to be met by an angry, arrogant, rude desk manager. He demanded we give him our passports to photocopy them (we have been travelling for almost 2 months all over the world and this was the 1st time we had to give passports in for photocopying). He said that the photocopier wasn't working and to leave the passports with him and he would return them to us whenever he got around to photocopying them in the next couple of days. I said that I would like to keep our passports and am happy to bring them down to him first thing in the morning if he likes. He shouted at us that he didn't care about Australia and was keeping the passports or we couldn't check into our rooms. I asked if he could copy the information down so that we were able to go to our rooms, so he did. After half an hour we were allowed to go to our room. The area the hotel is in was dirty and was far away from the thriving hub of venice, and does not represent the true Venetian experience. It was filthy and away from the shops and tourist attractions and restaurants. Our room had 3 beds shoved into a smelly dirty room. There was mould on the ceiling, and cracks in the walls, with lumps of plaster cracking and falling on the floor. "The bathroom was filthy. Someone was creeping around outside our door and we felt extremely scared and unsafe. We wanted to get out but it was very late at night and we had no transport means to get out and didn't know where to go. We were told there was internet in the rooms but couldn't see anything. I phoned the angry man at the front desk who said we had to connect it to the tv. There was no means to do this. So I phoned him again, and he said he would send a man from another hotel nearby to help us. Half an hour later a guy arrives, fiddles around with the tv which didn't work properly and informs us that the internet connection is non existant. He phoned the front desk to inform the guy who said there was nothing he could do. We were desperate to get out of here and didn't want to sleep the night. Next I tried phoning family in Australia to see if they could find something on the internet to book us in. The phone didn't work. There was no reception for my mobile phone (I realise this wasn't the hotels fault) however my teenage son had $30 left on his mobile which did have reception. We phoned family in Aust. explained our predicament and asked for help explaining the mobile phone credits would run out soon (which it did after that call.) By now it was around 2 am. Family booked us into a gorgeous hotel in the heart of Venice and tried to phone the hotel to let us know. The man at the front desk supposedly put the phone calls through to our room but we never received them. After one hour with no phone calls coming into our room I tried to phone Australia but the phone wasn't working. I tried for quite some time. In the meantime family trying to be put through into our room and front desk man saying he was trying to put us through but we weren't answering and must be asleep. We were not asleep. We tried to use the phone but it was dead. Family asked him to walk up to our room and let us know that they were trying to phone us, but the guy refused. Our room phone was intermittent. Our cousin phoned us to tell us she had found a hotel and booked it for us but the phone call cut out. We tried phoning our cousin, and other family members who were worried but the phone wasn't working again. Around 6.30 am after our family members had been constantly phoning and trying to get through to us, our cousin insisted someone take a message to us in our room which read "answer your phone". I realised that people had been trying to call us all night. I informed the man at the front desk that the phone was not working and he said that he would get an engineer to work on the phone some time today (engineer??). We looked into the poky, dingy old room that was supposed to be the breakfast room, as we were going to eat breakfast before we left, however, the small amount of food looked of poor quality. Scrambled eggs looked old and stale. Bacon was all fat and greasy. My daughter put a piece of canned pineapple on her plate and had a coffee and was going to have another pineapple ring but the waiter packed it away while my daughter was standing in front of it. I ate nothing. My son ate a stale bread roll. We checked out that morning and moved to the centre of Venice and went to the Bauer hotel which was beautiful and everything you expect your Venetian experience to be. Do not go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: k_and_g_from_seattle
Reviews.Content: This hotel was convenient to the train station, but grossly over valued. At least one front desk manager was incredibly rude and unhelpful. It might have been a great place once, but looked like the days of glory (if they existed) were well past.

Reviews.Title: “Ambivalent”
Reviews.Author: filamornl
Reviews.Content: I was unsure whether proximity to the train station, which is how we came into Venice, was a plus or not. It came in very handy when we had two large pieces of luggage as the place was about 5 minutes walk, but at the same time, the area where it was at looked like the most rundown part of the city. It was frequently crowded being in proximity to the train and vaporetto stations. The hotel itself is okay - not great. The room was on the small side, with doors that strangely open out to the hallway and that need to be locked at all times, otherwise it would be simply a door on a hinge. The staff were curt and unsmiling, especially the engineer who came to our room to look at our AC. It would seem a little bit of customer service training is called for. The best part of our stay - the buffet breakfast which proved to be a good start to another day in one of the most beautiful cities on Earth. Would I recommend this hotel? I wouldn't discount it as an option, but if there was a similarly priced/styled hotel in another part of the city, I would take it.

Reviews.Title: “Amadeus was a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: jbohan
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Amadeus. The water in the bathtub while showering did not drain. We reported the problem but it was not fixed. There is no wireless internet nor is there a computer for hotel guest use-unacceptable when people rely on computers to print boarding passes,etc.. They referred us to an internet cafe for 8 euros/hr.! The front desk clerk was arrogant and argumentative when I asked him to help me make a reservation for one of the museums. The breakfast was nicely displayed but there was no fresh fruit-just dried prunes and canned fruit cup. Compared to other hotels that we stayed in in Italy for a lesser cost than Amadeus, the services were woefully inferior.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: LaBen
Reviews.Content: Venice was our second stop for our honeymoon in Italy. We didnâ€™t have the best experience at our hotel in Rome, so I was apprehensive about what weâ€™d be met with in Venice. We were not disappointed. Hotel Amadeus, their staff and the city of Venice were beyond outstanding. We arrived via train and the hotel was literally down the street. Hotel was very charming and clean. We had a fairly large room for Europe however always a small shower! The air conditioner was a little difficult to figure out, but once we did it worked great â€“ there was also a nice breeze from our window but lots of mosquitoes. Both concierges were AMAZING. They were extremely nice, helped us with our luggage, gave great recommendations and directions for dinners and were just above and beyond what we would expect. The breakfast at the hotel was delicious. Great, fluffy eggs â€“ amazing ham and a cappuccino machine that was DELICIOUS and fun to use. Some days we woke up just in time for breakfast, and then went back to sleep if we were still tired. The city of Venice will always be dear to my heart. It was breathtaking. Beautiful buildings, great walking city, Piazza San Marco was beautiful. The #1 Vaporetto gets you basically everywhere. Food is outstanding but be wary of service and cover charges. There is a pizza place down the street from Amadeus, called Ginoâ€™s â€“ BEST PIZZA IN ITALY! Order the Prosciutto. We ate it probably twice a day. All in all, I would return to Venice in a heartbeat and stay at the exact same hotel. Amazing time, amazing hotel and amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel close to Attractions”
Reviews.Author: DTWinfield
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small as most of the hotels are in Venice. This hotel is well run and very clean and the food is of a high standard that is freshly prepared. The room was nicely decorated in a Venice renaissance style. We found this hotel charming with a relaxing atmosphere. There was a nice section of food to suit all tastes for breakfast. The breakfast room opened out to an enclosed courtyard; this gave an Italian Villa feel. The hotel is close to all the attractions. This hotel was excellent for a short stay holiday or a weekend break. We found the staff more than helpful. Venice is a great place to visit. It costs 1 Euro from Marco Polo airport. It takes 10-15 minutes. They you can stroll to your hotel from the bus station. You can buy a travel pass these are good value for money if you use the water buses. You can walk to everywhere. Donâ€™t rush as every street has something to see.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room in a bautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: DLaytoun
Reviews.Content: The staff wer helpful and friendly and the room was lovely, Comfortable sleep althought he air con was slightly noisy. The location is great, very near the station and the vaporetti station. Also good to walk all over Venice from this hotel. Breakfast was well served and good selection.

Reviews.Title: “DO YOURSELF A FAVOUR - CHOOSE ANOTHER HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Cracknet
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend for one night. As hotels go it wasn't great and was nowhere near what the website promised. I have seen a few good reviews on this site and it may be that there is a big difference between the rooms. However if you have a couple of hotels that you are considering, go with one of the others, Our night here was our last in Venice and it put a bit of a dampener on our stay. (Plus when I queried with the hotel staff they were so rude it was actually quite funny - but still didn't make up for the rubbish room) Luckily the rest of our time in Venice was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff needs etiquette class”
Reviews.Author: 2WorldTravelers11
Reviews.Content: Like another review I read, my husband and I were also stuck staying here after actually booking at it's sister hotel, Gardena - Principe Hotel 50 m away. After we arrived at the Principe, they looked up our name and told us that we were being transferred to Hotel Amadeus due to air conditioning problems. We then had to drag our bags down to Hotel Amadeus. Other people were checking in at Principe while we were there, so I'm not really sure if that was the truth. I wouldn't recommend either one if they would do this to guests. Seems to be common. They did however put us in a pretty large room. Aside from all this, my husband and I travel a lot and we are not picky at all. We just ask for a clean room and nice staff members. The room was fine, but the staff completely ruined my stay. They made me feel pretty bad. My husband and I were leaving the hotel at about 11:00 one night to just walk around as everyone else was doing. We had been taking our keys with us the entire time and didn't think about leaving it at the desk, but an older man at the desk asked for it before we left. My husband simply said, "Oh, I didn't know I had to leave it, but that's not a problem, you're the first person to ask for it." The old man yelled at us and said, "What do you mean I'm the first one to tell you?" and mumbled some stuff under his breath. He then said that he was going to lock the hotel soon, so we were confused. We asked him how we would get in and he shrugged his shoulders. Still calm, we asked him what time and he said he didn't know. We were completely confused. We're very laid back people and don't do a lot of complaining so we ended up picking up some water and snacks and came right back. At this point, we thought maybe it was all a mix up or misunderstanding. That night was ruined, but I was still okay at this point. The next morning, we approached a tall younger man at the desk and was wondering about the door locking policy at the hotel. First, he ignored us and kept helping other people that came to the desk. We finally asked him about it and he blew us off and said that it was "impossible", whatever that may mean. We then asked him what we should do if it was locked and he said, just ring the door bell and someone will come. That's all he had to say. Instead, he added that if we want to complain, then go ahead and write a manager complaint card and rudely told us again that it was impossible. This really did it for me. We would've been fine with just a simple explanation. He was not trying to help us. My husband and I are in our 30's, but look fairly young, but that does not give someone the right to treat us like that. It really upset me a lot. I've stayed at so many places and have never felt so bad. It's hard to explain how rude they were. My explanation is pretty low key. I also noticed how they spoke to minorities, especially if they don't speak Italian. We noticed an incident when we first arrived. They have no respect. The only staff member that was nice was an older semi-grayed hair gentleman that worked during the day. He was there often. He was very helpful. I can't remember his name. He saved my stay. I didn't talk to anyone but him if I had to.

Reviews.Title: “Buona posizione, personale imbranato”
Reviews.Author: ultimo_boulevard
Reviews.Content: I was there during one of the most important venetian recurrence: "la festa del Redentore". So the hotel was really full. Anyway, I reserved a double room via lastimute.com and they had problems with it: my payment did not result in their system. They made me and my girl wait in the hall for an hour. The hotel is a little garish, but comfortable enough and clean. Slightly poor the breakfast. Great position (the station and Cannareggio's zones are beautiful) but a little uncomfortable for the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Amadeus or Crystal Maze”
Reviews.Author: RuchS
Reviews.Content: Amadeus is a 3-5 minute walk from the railway station. The rooms are average sized. None of the rooms face the water body all around venice. The interiors are nice, and the breakfast is standard - scrambelled eggs and ham everyday. Vegetarians like me had to survive on bread .We were there for 2 days. The hotel is about a 20 minute walk from the central area which is St. Marks square. If you take the stairs to get to your room, you may confused due to the construction of the hotel. The hotel lane has a pizza joint next to it, and also has a sushi restaurant in the same premise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but inadequate cooling”
Reviews.Author: aviatortom
Reviews.Content: Great location with friendly staff. Nice breakfast. However, room was hot and airconditioning just added more heat. With window open, it meant open season for the mosquitos and lots of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and great location...”
Reviews.Author: RonnieScot
Reviews.Content: Having read a few "extreme" reviews I want to add some balance to these comments. The hotel is probably upper 3 star by uk standards. The room we had was smallish but nicely decorated and the air con meant we were comfortable at all times. The bathroom was small, but acceptable. The location was great. Just 500 yards from the bus and railway stations. Close to the Grand Canal. Lots of good restaurants and bars nearby. At the better value end of town. TIP The closer you get to St Marks Square the higher the prices are. Hotel staff were excelent - reception were knowledgable and willing to help. The breakfast was nice but exactly the same every day. Are there better hotels?- probably but you will pay more for them. Would I stay there again ?- absolutely. For value for money we thought it was excellent. We booked it in a combined Easyjet / accommodation package. Travel tip. Buy the 2,3 or 4 day Vaporetto boat pass (depending on how long you are there) and use the boats to get round the entire island. There are dozens of "stations" so you can hop between areas no problem. Remember there are no motorised vehicles in any shape or form on the island. This area is not suited to anyone in a wheelchair -too many bridges with lots of steps. Enjoy...

Reviews.Title: “Loved Venice...shame about the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: shampayne
Reviews.Content: Mt friend managed to get this hotel really cheap as part of a superbreak deal so it did not cost us a great deal of money which is just as well really...... We had a really small and very hot room right at the very top of the hotel..... the view from our window was the hotel roof!! The walls are very thin so we could pretty much hear every movement of our neighbours, when they showered, when they went to the loo etc. The room was also a favourite haunt for mosquito's to visit... I came back home with a grand total of 18 mosquito bites and my friend received 12 bites, 5 of which were to her face. There were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room which really suprised me as this is supposed to be a 4* hotel. The staff were not very friendly and i do not think i even saw one of them crack a smile during our visit. The breakfast was quite nice, although very limited in selection of things to have. We only stayed in Venice for 2 nights so it was ok for our needs but i certainly could not have stayed longer than that.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Thousandeurist
Reviews.Content: Disappointing. As dull and none worthy as you might wonder, just having a look at the hotel picture appearing on its website. Ugly. Streets around are as plain and un-welcoming as the hotel itself. You donâ€™t have the feeling of being in Venice once you left the Great Channel behind your back, heading for this place. Big contrast with the glorious atmosphere you breathe everywhere else. Even if I stayed just a night I couldnâ€™t help but regret my choice. It declares being a 4*, but donâ€™t believe it. There is nothing about the hotel, none the breakfast, amenities or even staff that worth such rating. I would rather say an average 2* (if they make an additional effort). Double room I requested comprised of two single beds pushed together. There was another bed attached to the walls that makes the space available in the room even smaller. Bathroom un-noticeable. Everything else to forget. It doesnâ€™t worth you to pay a visit, having so many options in Venice. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Amadeus”
Reviews.Author: Floridians33596
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a night on 6/8/08. We found this hotel to be clean and the staff were very helpful & courteous. The breakfast that was served was excellent! Overall it was a fantastic stay! We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Alternative”
Reviews.Author: heund
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amadeus 2 nights in May as part of Gate 1 tour, but were supposed to stay in Principe 50 yards away. Amadeus is a poor alternative - owned by the same group as Principe, the owners rate it as 4 star. We then stayed 3 nights in the Principe on our own - there is no comparison - the Principe has better rooms, a restaurant and bar with patio on the Grand Canal, and is in better condidion. The Amadeus had small, old rooms, no real amenities (tho they do have a breakfast room), and an elevator that holds only 2 people (the Principe has 2 that hold 10 each). Booking prices list the difference as only 15 Euros - the Principe is worth far more than that difference.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: asacjack
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Venice in April 2008. This hotel is about 5 min from the train station and main boat docks, making it easy to get to and travel from. Well maintained, it appears to have been recently (< 3 years) renovated. Staff was great. Rooms, especially the bathrooms, are a little small, but well appointed and spotless. Breakfasts are provided and are very well done. Should we have the opportunity to return to Venice, we will make this our first choice of locations.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location close to canals and easy arrive to walk with bags.”
Reviews.Author: RodolfoBariloche
Reviews.Content: Excelente hotel, Tipical venetian style. is not more better 4 stars but is very good hotel. Good Bathroom and good bedroom. very close to canals, very close to the venezian dreams but very close to Train station and Piazza Roma (arrival bus from airport).

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, OK service”
Reviews.Author: DUSNj
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice pleasant hotel. The people at the front desk were not the warmest, but not rude either. The room quality was excellent. Rooms were modern, clean, and nice size, and the same applies to the bathroom. There's room for improvement as far as the front desk staff friendliness goes; not bad people, just lack passion in helping out. In addition, there is NO internet in the hotel, which meant that whenever I needed to send emails or review the web, I had to go to the lobby of a different hotel nearby, which was somewhat annoying.

Reviews.Title: “A true 5 Star Hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: ORawls
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of the Campagnia section of Venice this hotel is a gem. Great service from the staff and absolutely the best and cleanest rooms in all of Italy. You feel like you are royalty staying in their rooms with their 14 foot high ceilings, antique furniture and Italian styled wall coverings and moldings. Extremely comfortable beds and a 24 inch flat panel TV round out their very spacious rooms. The dining area is first class and the free HOT breakfast is very impressive (think hot eggs and bacon, fresh pastries and full coffee and juice bar). The best part is that once you step outside of this luxurious hotel you are in the heart of a bustling main walkway with stores, vendors, and restaurants. The main Venice train station Stazione FerroviarÃ­a, is a 3 minute walk and the public transport via water bus is also a 3 minute walk. A nice Internet cafe is only 50 yards from the front door. You will not be disappointed I promise you. Ciao!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: creaty
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel after no availability on others. It was in an excellent position, close to the vaporettos, walking and good restaurants. Rooms were good by central European standards, clean and quiet. We had a room overlooking the quiet courtyard garden. Overall I would stay here again based on position and standard of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RoseAlee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a cruise from Venice to Athens. We elected to stay three nights at the Amadeus based on the tripadvisor reviews. I booked via Orbitz at a cost of $193 per night. I also found the price a little high for a 3 star hotel, but we were not disappointed. I thought, mistakenly, that I had requested a superior room situated in the front part of the hotel. Nevertheless, the hotel was fully booked and no upgrades were avaiable. We ended up in a 3rd floor room in the rear overlooking the garden. The room was a bit small, but we did not spend a lot of time lounging around in bed. Being in the rear of the hotel resulted in quiet and peaceful sleep after a busy day. Our room was clean, well maintained and comfortable. The breakfasts were more than adequate and coffee machine made the best individual cups of expresso, cafe, cappachino and american coffee - All from the same machine. (I want one of those!) Emanuele (front desk) referred us to Anrica Bessera ristorante. Don't miss this eatery when in Venice! There also is a trattoria approximately 1/2 block to the left as you leave the Amadeus (go past the Irish pub). The sardines in saor is just plain delicious with the traditional pine nuts and raisens. There is not view of the canal, but I would definitely stay here again and would request the rear again because of the location (less tourist traffic and convenient to other past of Venice). A water taxi ride will cost you 90 Euros from the airport, 60 Euros from the hotel to the cruise ship dock, and it's worth it when you have a lot of heavy luggage. Larry & Kelly, Georgetown, Texas

Reviews.Title: “good location, shame about the basic breakfast and rooms”
Reviews.Author: sandy90
Reviews.Content: Well located - with lots of reasonably priced cafes and restaurants nearby together with easy access to all public transport.It was refreshing to return to this quieter part of Venice after a busy day of sightseeing in the very crowded, touristy areas of the Rialto and St Marks. The Hotel Amadeus is just slightly overpriced for what I thought was a very basic hotel. The lobby is nice but the rooms, although clean and comfortable are basic with very small cupboards and drawers.The lighting is very poor- and even with all the lamps/lights on, reading in bed becomes impossible. We stayed for 3 nights and the breakfast everyday was the same- there was no decent bread to make toast!!- (dry french toast in packets and a few rolls were available). The only "warm" breakfast was scrambled egg and greasy bacon -I cannot agree with some of the reviews I had read about the Amadeus where some people described the breakfast as "excellent"-it was enough but lacked imagination and variety. At Â£105 per night per room that we paid I would have expected slightly higher standards even for a city hotel. If you get a good deal on this hotel it is worth considering as it is so well-located and ok for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “nice lobby, but small bed and rooms”
Reviews.Author: NessaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful trip to Italy and was so excited to stay at the Hotel Amadeus, especially from the photos they posted on their website. Unfortunately, I had relied on the previous reviews by other travelers and photos a little too much. The breakfast was good, with a nice selection to choose from and the garden was pleasant too, but the room and bed were the smallest ones we had encountered on our entire trip. I almost fell out of bed a couple times. Also our shower leaked, so our floor got flooded everytime we took a shower. The concierge was nice, they recommended two great restaurants for dinner. The price seemed a little high for a 3 star hotel, but we were there on a weekend. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, if you don't mind a very small bed or room.
